cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 215 mi SW of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest parallel to the Baja California peninsula, then bending northwest and passing just southwest of southern California late Friday into Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-western Baja California peninsula (near Punta Eugenia area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cabo San Quintin northward to the U.S./Mexico border (west coast of Baja California)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: North of Punta Abreojos to San Jose De Las Palomas.  Tropical Storm Warning: Punta Abreojos southward to Cabo San Lucas and San Jose De Las Palomas to Cabo San Quintin, plus entire east coast of Baja and mainland Mexico south to Guaymas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula, Gulf of California shoreline, and southern California coastline including San Diego County
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible – forecast calls for 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches in southernmost California
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely – mainly large surf/rip currents rather than true surge above 3 ft
weather_observation.wind: Low but non-zero risk (≈5%) of sustained 34-kt winds Friday night–Saturday; gusts 35–45 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large swells and hazardous surf; minor coastal flooding possible, surge generally < 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday–Saturday could total 2–4 in, locally 6 in, causing urban and flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents, high surf, localized mud/rock slides in burn scar or steep terrain areas.
